comments:
I install Mylar in Europa (3.3M7) and restart the workspace.  Within a minute or so, a popup window appears that says

Problem Occurred
Scheduled task data backup
Reason:
java.lang.internalError

The details just repeat the same thing.  Another dialog then pops up and recommends that I exit the workbench.  I decline this and don't see any bad consequences, except that sometimes it kills my whole update session, which I have to run again.

At this point I've installed, uninstalled, and reinstalled Europa (platform or SDK) many times due to various errors, so it's a little hard to say exactly when this happens, but it always does happen shortly after I install Mylar.  My .log file is below.

Thanks,
Andrew.

Could you let us know the exact Mylar version?  Also, if it is not 2.0.0.v20070511-2100 could you see if you can replicate with the latest from: http://download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/update-site/dev/e3.3

> > Could you let us know the exact Mylar version?  Also, if it is
> > not 2.0.0.v20070511-2100 could you see if you can replicate with the
> > latest from:
> > http://download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/update-site/dev/e3.3

Sorry, it seems I left that detail out... no, I was using an earlier 
version, from the Europa Discovery Site-- 2.0.0.v20070503 or so I think it 
was.

I'm now using 2.0.0.v20070511-2100 from the Mylar site, and I can't 
reproduce the problem any more.  So I'm changing the status of this bug to FIXED.  If the problem should recur, I'll reopen it.

Thanks,
Andrew.
